text: the man who could work miracles
by h.g wells
until he was 30 years old
fathering gay did not believe in
miracles in fact
he discovered his own unusual powers
at the moment when he was claiming that

he was having a drink at his local inn
and
toddy beamish was driving him to the

by disagreeing with everything he said
so you say answered beamish whenever
fathering gay spoke
there were present besides these two a
very

she was standing with her back to mr

washing glasses the others were watching

listen mr beamish said mr fatheringgay
annoyed by his opposition
let us clearly understand what
a miracle is it's something
against the laws of nature done
by the power of will something
that couldn't happen without being
specially willed
so you say said mr beamish
the cyclist agreed with mr fatheringgay
but the innkeeper did not express an

for example said mr fathering
here would be a miracle that
lamp in the normal course of nature
couldn't burn like that upside down
could it be mish you say it couldn't
said beamish and you
said fathering gay you don't mean to say
no said bemish at last
no it couldn't very well
said mr fatheringgay then here comes
someone perhaps myself and stands here
perhaps and says to that lamp as i might

collecting all my will turn
upside down without breaking
and go on burning steadily
and hello it was enough to make anyone

the lamp hung upside down in the air

it was as solid as ever a lamp was
mr fatheringgay stood with a finger
stretched out and
the troubled face of one expecting a
terrible
crash the cyclist who was sitting next

for nearly three seconds the lamp

i can't keep it up he said any longer
the lamp suddenly fell broke on the

mr cox was the first to speak remarking

fathering gay himself was astonished at

the conversation which followed gave no
explanation of the matter
and the general opinion agreed with mr
cox's view
that fathering gay was a fool for
playing such a trick
his own mind was terribly confused
and he rather agreed with them he went
home
red-faced and hot he watched each of the
ten street lamps
nervously as he passed it it was only
when he found himself in his bedroom
that he was able to think clearly he had
taken off his shoes
and was sitting on the bed saying for
the 17th
time i didn't want the thing to turn
over
when he remembered that just by saying

the thing to happen he decided to try
his new
powers again he pointed to the candle

though he felt that he was behaving
foolishly
but in a second that feeling disappeared
be raised up he said
the candle rose up hung
in the air for a moment and then fell
with a

for a time mr fatheringgay sat there
perfectly still
it did happen he said
and how i'm going to explain it i don't
know
he felt in his pockets for a match he
could find
none so he felt on the table he tried
his coat
and there were none there and then it
came to his mind
that miracles were possible even with

he stretched out a hand
let there be a match in that hand
he said he felt a light object fall
across his hand and his fingers
closed on a match after several useless

he threw it down and then he realized
that he could have willed it to be lit
he did so and saw it burning on the
table
he picked it up quickly and it went out
he became more adventurous and put the
candle back in its place be
lit said mr fathering gay and
immediately
the candle burst into flame
for a time he looked at it and then he
looked carefully into the mirror
what about miracles now said mr
fatheringgay
speaking to his own shadowed face
mr fatheringgay was becoming very
confused so far as he could understand
he had only to will things and they
would happen
after his first experiences he wished to

but he lifted a sheet of paper into the

and turned a glass of water pink

by the early hours of the morning he had

that willpower must be unusual
and strong the fears of his first

he heard the church clock strike one and
undressed in order to get into bed
without further delay as he struggled to
undress
he had a wonderful idea let me
be in bed he said and found himself
there undressed
he said and finding the sheets cold
added quickly
and in a soft woolen night shirt
ah he said with pleasure
and now let me be comfortably
asleep he awoke
at his usual hour and wondered if his
experiences had been a dream
he decided to test his skills again
he had three eggs for breakfast two
were supplied by his housekeeper one
was a much better egg laid cooked
and served by his own unusual
will he hurried off to work
very excited all day
he could do no work because of his
astonishing new self-knowledge
but this did not matter because he did
all the work by a miracle
in the last 10 minutes as the day

to pleasure it was clear that he must be

but in other ways his powers seemed more

thought about them he increased his

by making new things for himself but he
could see
that he must be careful about that too
people might wonder how he got them
after supper he went out for a walk on a

his attempts could perhaps have been

but apart from his willpower mr

the air was immediately full of the

but his satisfaction ended when he heard

he was afraid that someone would

and he said quickly to the stick go back
what he meant was change back

and there came a shout of anger who are

i'm very sorry the fact is

you're the man who doesn't believe in

the fact is this is another of your

it's a powerful gift an extremely

that far i wonder where winter's gone
he sat on the bed and took off his shoes
he had a happy thought and sent the

in the night he dreamt of winch's anger

most of the time he was thinking of

was not a regular churchgoer but decided

was pleased when the young man asked to

you will hardly believe me mr may dig

i suppose said fathering that some

it's possible said mr maydig something

perhaps is possible if
i may try with something here i think i

that pot on the table for example
